google_play_reviews.content: Great to have no ads and no tracking, but bad to be no fun to play. Two problems could easily be fixed for a five-star game: (1) Upon either winning or losing, the game immediately blocks the view of the board, so it is not possible to review one's play to consider his it might be improved. (2) Minesweepers should open squares by quick tapping and mark them by long tapping. This one requires for a button to be pressed to toggle between these functions, destroying the flow of the game.

google_play_reviews.content:
Great game, No spying chaupo, No permissions. Sources available yet has few things to wish for 1. Times exidently press button next to intendent 2. No step back
3. After failure.message covers board so cannot analyze mistake 
4. After failure doesn't revile bomb locations, what could be useful for analyzes.
5. Games in progress, keeps lots of failed or finished games what i find useless<> 6. On s7 edge. Displays lower row halve way
It's basic Minesweeper with no ads or unnecessary permissions. It has 3 difficulty settings. Each setting increases the number of squares & mines.

Unlike some minesweeper clones, i didn't have lag playing this game. Sadly it cannot be moved to SD despite not requiring permissions. The game is silent; a loud explosion sound when uncovering a bomb would make the game more thrilling (I can always mute android volume). I haven't yet found a mobile clone that does this properly besides microsoft's own minesweeper (PC). Also, tapping a button to switch between flag/uncover is slow, it could be improved with gestures e.g. long-tap.
good game with no ads. but the numbers should be bigger and perhaps colour scheme changed as text is hard to read
